briefTitle: Outcomes of Patients Who Survived Treatment on an Intensive Care Unit for COVID-19 in England and Wales
officialTitle: Outcomes of Patients Who Survived Treatment on an Intensive Care Unit for COVID-19 in England and Wales: a Comparative Retrospective Cohort Study (OPTIC-19)

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age 16 years or over
* Admitted to an adult, general ICU in England or Wales as an emergency (unplanned)
* Admitted to ICU for either: a) confirmed COVID-19 between 1st January to 1st July 2020 or b) without confirmed COVID-19 between 1st July 2016 and 1st July 2020-

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who died in hospital after treatment on an ICU

secondary.measure: Rate of emergency hospital admission for respiratory infection
secondary.description: Emergency hospital admission for respiratory infection

secondary.measure: Rate of emergency hospital admission for a major adverse cardiac event
secondary.description: Emergency hospital admission for a major adverse cardiac event (myocardial infarction, stroke, heart failure)

secondary.measure: Rate of emergency hospital admission for a venous thrombotic event
secondary.description: Emergency hospital admission for a venous thrombotic event (deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism)

secondary.measure: Rate of development of end stage renal failure
secondary.description: Development of end stage renal failure treated by renal replacement therapy
